page.title: 06ATTLETON GREEN
page.content: The Green itself is one of the finest of the Greens of Wickhambrook (some of which are very tiny). Attleton Green has a pond, with shady trees around it, and which is surrounded by pleasant cottages and houses. Some of these are quite new (fetching #60 000 in 1985) but he most picturesque is the Old Workhouse. This thatched building now known as Woodlea and East Cottage, has recently been restored and re- thatched. There is a 16th Century farmhouse - Butlers Hall - and two other farmhouses - Grove Farm and Attleton Farm - and all are occupied by practising farmers. Melford House is the HQ of an Agricultural contractor. To the W of the Green is a small development of modern bungalows.
